intro: Galium terrae-reginae, commonly known as the royal earth plant, is a herbaceous species belonging to the Rubiaceae family. It is characterized by its slender, creeping stems and small, opposite leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. The plant produces clusters of tiny, white to pale pink flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its fruit is a small, dry capsule that contains several seeds. Galium terrae-reginae is typically found in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks.
